intro: Arctotis dregei, commonly known as the African marguerite, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its bright yellow to orange flower heads consist of numerous small florets arranged in a circular pattern. Arctotis dregei is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is adapted to well-drained soils and full sun.
